title: 107_s1905
content:
The Act includes a table of contents outlining sections related to veterans' health-care improvements, veterans' benefit programs, and VA program administration improvements. Key provisions include care for newborn children of enrolled women veterans, outpatient dental care for former prisoners of war, and clarification of procedures for disqualification of individuals for memorialization in veterans cemeteries. Title I of the Act focuses on veterans' health-care improvements, including provisions such as care for newborn children of enrolled women veterans. It also addresses outpatient dental care for former prisoners of war and clarifies procedures for disqualification of individuals for memorialization in veterans cemeteries. Section 1701 is amended to include care for newborn children of women veterans enrolled in the VA health care system. This care can be provided until the mother is discharged from the hospital after delivery or for 14 days after the child's birth, whichever is shorter. The Department only contracts for the delivery of the child. SEC. 102 amends outpatient dental care for former prisoners of war. SEC. 103 adjusts pay comparability for the Director of Nursing Service. TITLE II introduces limitations on certain veterans' benefit programs. The text introduces prohibitions on furnishing certificates, flags, headstones, and markers for deceased veterans described in a specific section of the title. The amendments made by this section regarding deaths shall apply to occurrences on or after the enactment date. SEC. 202 clarifies procedures for disqualifying individuals for burial in veterans cemeteries. SEC. 203 clarifies the timeframe for appealing rulings of the Board of Veterans Appeals. TITLE III--VA PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION IMPROVEMENTS

SEC. 301. REPEAL OF CAP ON NUMBER OF NON-CAREER MEMBERS OF SENIOR EXECUTIVE SERVICE SERVING IN VA. Section 709(a) is repealed and subsections (b) and (c) are re-designated as subsections (a) and (b) respectively.

SEC. 302. REPEAL OF PRECEDING-SERVICE REQUIREMENT FOR VA DEPUTY ASSISTANT SECRETARIES. Amendments made by subsection (a) apply to Board of Veterans' Appeals decisions made on or after the date of enactment of this Act. SEC. 303 amends Section 8121(a) to include medical supplies, equipment, and services for the Department of Defense. SEC. 304 redefines "minority group member" in 38 U.S.C. Sec. 544(d) to include specific ethnicities such as American Indian, Asian, African American, Native Hawaiian, and Hispanic.
